intro: Aegiphila hoehnei var. hoehnei, commonly known as the Hoehne's aegiphila, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
